poem:
Title: Imperfections Noted, Redressed

Upon morning's canvas, misprints dew,
Simons, not founder, yet Labour through.
In Bromley now resides Orpington's heart,
Kent's child lost to London's cart.

Amended narratives steep in ink,
In silent whispers, make one think.
Revisions echo in the scribe's refrain,
A story's truth is in its pain.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Corrections and clarifications • Josh Simons, Labour’s parliamentary candidate for Makerfield, is a former director of the Labour Together thinktank, but not its founder (Ten to watch: Rising stars who could play a big part in a Labour government, 5 June, p11). • Though historically in the county of Kent, Orpington has been in the London Borough of Bromley since 1965 (Cyber-attack disrupts seven NHS hospitals in London, 5 June, p16). • Other recently amended articles". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Corrections and clarifications • Josh Simons, Labour’s parliamentary candidate for Makerfield, is a former director of the Labour Together thinktank, but not its founder (Ten to watch: Rising stars who could play a big part in a Labour government, 5 June, p11). • Though historically in the county of Kent, Orpington has been in the London Borough of Bromley since 1965 (Cyber-attack disrupts seven NHS hospitals in London, 5 June, p16). • Other recently amended articles
